document.docAuthor: Constantino, Reginaldo & Carvalho, Sérgio H. C.
document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of the Neotropical termite genus Cyrilliotermes Fontes (Isoptera, Termitidae, Syntermitinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of the Neotropical termite genus Cyrilliotermes Fontes (Isoptera, Termitidae, Syntermitinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Curvitermes strictinasus Mathews 1977 : 227
[imago, soldier]. Holotype : MZSP (soldier), examined. Type-locality: Brazil , Mato Grosso, Ribeirão Cascalheira, base camp of the Xavantina-Cachimbo Expedition (
12.8167 °S
,
51.7667 °W
).
Cyrilliotermes strictinasus
;
Fontes 1985
: 16

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Cyrilliotermes cupim
Fontes 1985
: 12
[imago, soldier]; Fontes 1998 : 376 [gut]. Holotype : MZSP (soldado), examined. Typelocality: Brazil , Minas Gerais, Barbacena. New synonym

FIGURES 10. Worker mandibles. A,
Cyrilliotermes angulariceps
; B,
C. brevidens
,
sp. n.
; C,

,
sp. n.
; D,

; E,
C. strictinasus
: molar plate.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Imago (
Fig. 7
). Described by Mathews ( 1977 ) and by
Fontes ( 1985 )
. Measurements in
Table 1
.

Soldier (
Fig. 8
A–E, 9 E–F). Described by Mathews ( 1977 ) and by
Fontes ( 1985 )
. Measurements in
Table 2
.

Worker (
Figs. 8
F–G, 10 D–E, 11, 12G–H). Head capsule rounded hemi-ellipsoid, with convex sides, narrowing posteriorly. Postclypeus conspicuously inflated. Relative length of antennal articles: 1 > 6 > 2 = 5 > 3 > 4 , combined length of 3 rd + 4 th shorter than 6 th. Cushions of enteric valve armature with narrow tip, which evert a little into P 3 ; spines are mostly straight (
Fig. 12
H). Measurements in
Table 3
.

Comparisons. Compared to
C. angulariceps
and
C. brevidens
, the soldier of
C. strictinasus
is larger and has a more elongate head, and its nasus is not upturned. Their mandibles are also distinct, with a relatively short apical tooth and concave cutting edge between A and M 1 . The worker is, on average, larger than in the other species, and its enteric valve armature has cushions with narrow posterior tips, which advance a little into P 3 .

Remarks. This species occurs only in open vegetation, in the cerrado domain (
Fig. 15
). It is often found associated with nests of
Cornitermes
spp. Mathews's ( 1977 : 226 , Fig. 182 a) illustration of the soldier mandible lacks detail and is not representative (probably based on an atypical specimen). The most common shapes of soldier mandibles are illustrated in
Figs. 9
E and
9 F.
The new synonymy is based on the observation of soldiers identifiable as
C. cupim
and
C. strictinasus
from the same colony, and all intermediate forms between them. Also, the imagos of
C. cupim
and
C. strictinasus
are identical (
Fontes 1985 : 14
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 11.
Cyrilliotermes strictinasus
. Gut morphology in situ : A, dorsal; B, right; C, ventral; D, left; E, mixed segment; F, attachment of malpighian tubules.
